alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 10:40AM CDT until August 07 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Big River at Byrnesville. Meramec River near Eureka. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meramec River near Eureka. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, West Spring River Road becomes inundated at this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 21.0 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Meramec River Eureka 19.0 5.7 15.5 20.5 19.8 14.7 9.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
